result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven P. Ashman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with Counts 2, 3 and 4 and with 14CF871, 15CF29 and 15CF31

superMiscConds.notes: The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment.   The Defendant is to have no contact with Phillip Karner and Allison Gantzer.   The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  The Defendant is subject to random drug/UA testing/blood/breath/urine/hair/tissue.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
